top_comment.text: Is everyone on earth some how connected to Darcy?﻿
top_comment.author: normandyangel

comments.text: In Jane Austen's world, I dare say yeah they all are! lol
comments.author: karimam1275

comments.text: The world only has 55 people in it
comments.author: Emily Sorano

top_comment.text: I feel like there were some gay vibes in this video... just maybe...﻿
top_comment.author: Chocolatemew

comments.text:
+Niamh Flanagan Okey... I see, you made your point!Who am I to censure 
you anyway  (which I didn't by the way) as literature, or any other form of 
Art, is subject to different interpretations! So if you see gay vibes it's 
just your subjectivity that's talking...and it's all right!
comments.author: karimam1275

comments.text:
+karimam1275 This was shot in 2012.. Homosexuality has always existed? even 
when the original P&P  was written, it existed.. And especially in 2012, it 
was a mainly socially accepted thing, why they hell not should it feature 
in the LBD vids??! Dumb.
comments.author: Niamh Flanagan

comments.text:
By gay you mean  jovial or good-spirited , happy...right?! because if 
you're insinuating something else... let me tell you that OKey, it's a 
modern version, but not that modern! lol
comments.author: karimam1275

top_comment.text:
I'm 2 minutes into this video. Did she forget that Darcy watches these 
videos now?﻿
top_comment.author: Leighla

comments.text:
+juwietannie
I agree. I mean, it is similar in P&P - after receiving his letter and 
before she meets him again, Elizabeth is so concerned with how she 
misjudged Darcy that she assumes he must have turned his back on her. So 
that would fit.
comments.author: Heowa

comments.text:
this is what i think-
she is obviously aware that Darcy is aware of the videos, but is not sure 
if he is still watching them. i think she thinks that after exposing her 
videos and feelings toward him, she thinks he is no longer interested in 
her and doesn't care to watch the videos. i think that's why she is so 
surprised in the next video when he makes the hills reference.
comments.author: juwietannie

top_comment.text:
How is their family in such intense debt but the kids are all pretty 
comfortable, AFTER student loan debt? All three sisters have had a 
reference made to 'their car'. So three cars, plus at least one for the 
parents...how?
I won't make a judgment here b/c this may just be an American (as opposed 
to Cdn) distinction. But I do find this curious...﻿
top_comment.author: FroMaestro

comments.text:
If you live in an area where you can't take a train, subway, or bus to work 
each day, you HAVE TO HAVE A CAR. I suspect that the Bennett sisters are in 
that situation. Besides, most young adults have crappy used cars. At last 
my first car was crappy and used.
comments.author: BeedlePencil

comments.text:
I have a fair amount of debt from student loans, live with my parents who 
are also pretty in debt, I am comfortable and have everything I need, which 
includes my own car (as do both my sisters and each of my parents). Maybe 
it's just me, but this seems pretty typical.
comments.author: MissKoura

comments.text:
+Chrystel Marincich "To be able to get a decent job here having a higher ed 
degree is pretty much a must". I disagree with that assertion, but this is 
now out of scope from my original comment so I will bow out here and wish 
you a good day. As I always say, may we all soon slay our debt loads =]
comments.author: FroMaestro

comments.text:
+FroMaestro "I think 'essentially forcing [student] debt' goes too far. " 
Not really. To be able to get a decent job here having a higher ed degree 
is pretty much a must, and schools can cost as much as 50,000 dollars a 
year only for tuition, so even working before might not help you save 
enough. So if you want to attend school to have a good career you have to 
take on student loan, which can have an interest rate of 7%. So I have to 
agree with Eclectic Ginger's comment.
comments.author: Chrystel Marincich

comments.text:
"Plus many of these US colleges/universities are essentially forcing 
college students/families to take on such horrendous debts."
I don't follow. Higher ed isn't compulsory. And one *can* work to save up 
in part before attending. I think 'essentially forcing [student] debt' goes 
too far. But I feel you--and past commenters--on the point about some 
places being unlivable without a car.
comments.author: FroMaestro

comments.text:
Also depending on where you live in the US (particularly CA), you almost 
have to have a car in order to get around, so it really would make sense 
for this family to have quite a few vehicles. Plus many of these US 
colleges/universities are essentially forcing college students/families to 
take on such horrendous debts. It's a pretty troubling state to be honest 
:-(
comments.author: Electric Ging'

comments.text:
I agree with a lot of the things that have been said so far, but I also 
think that they might be about to be "poor" as opposed to actually there 
yet. They have mountains of debt, they have a house, but the consequences 
aren't quite there yet. Also, in regard to the cars, I think it was a 
manner of speaking thing, I think that the kids share one and the parents 
share one.
comments.author: Cabitha T

comments.text:
Also the Bennets are meant to be British gentry - poor British genty - but 
still.  That means that they're comfortable despite being in debt.  And 
isn't everyone in debt?
comments.author: Zoe Jasmine Whittle

comments.text:
hm, that's really interesting. I guess cars a more a necessity in some 
conditions than others. I guess I was just anchored by the original story 
to see the Bennets as a modest family, and 4+ cars seems...not modest lol. 
We shall slay our debt-loads, some soon-coming day!
comments.author: FroMaestro

comments.text:
It's because it's all in debt. My parents are in the exact same situation, 
but in order for me to go to school, I have to have a car which means 
there's more debt, etc, etc. Basically it means that the parents are still 
bringing in money to pay for the necessities while the debt slowly carves 
away at their lives, lol.
comments.author: S. Kay Lanphear

top_comment.text:
Ok. So who thinks Gigi totally made a name badge that said Lizzie Darcy 
also. I mean. She's such a huge Dizzie shipper..﻿
top_comment.author: Elizabeth

comments.text:
When they get engaged she gives it to her immediately, and when Lizzie asks 
how she made it so fast, she's like, "Oh... I made it a while ago. Um... 
around the time you... uh... came to Pemberley...
comments.author: Alanna R.

comments.text:
Absolutely! :D Even in the original book, I can't shake the feeling that 
Georgiana didn't just like Elizabeth because her brother had told her so 
many good things about her, but mainly because she saw how he had changed 
and immediately entered the ship. ;-)
comments.author: Heowa

captions.text: Lizzie: Hi, everyone!
Well, here I am, at the international headquarters for Pemberly Digital.
Which is...
William Darcy's company.
Yeah. Charlotte and all of the internet filled me in on that little
factoid about five seconds after my last video ended.
And yes, I tried to get out of this being one of the companies that I shadow,
but Dr. Gardiner said due to the compressed time frame for my independent study,
I would have to make up those credits next semester so,
either I risk awkwardly running into Darcy or I don't graduate on time.
But regardless of how tough a choice that actually was...
My name is Lizzie Bennet and welcome to Pemberley!
...Digital.

"Tour Leader"
Written by Kate Rorick
Lizzie: I can't be wrong for wanting to avoid him, right?
It would just be too...weird.
Especially under these circumstances.
Luckily, his Twitter account assures me that he is in
Los Angeles with no intentions of coming back up here anytime soon.
That's right, I Twitter-stalked him, don't judge me.
And I think it's a good thing that he's not here, because
it would be really hard to admit in front of him that this place is incredible!
The state-of-the-art facilities, the in-house creative departments, the landscaping!
Seriously, you wouldn't think of a corporate building in a major metropolitan area as having grounds,
but they have done some amazing things with the topiary around the rooftop pool.
It's all so much more than I expected.
Tour Leader: Hi! I just wanted to check back in with you,
you know, make sure you're getting all settled. I see you're filming already.
Lizzie: Uh, yes, I hope that's okay. These videos are a part of my thesis project.
Tour Leader: Oh, I know. The Lizzie Bennet Diaries are very popular around here.
Lizzie: You...you all know about my videos?
Tour Leader: Before we approved your shadowing here at Pemberley Digital,
we researched you thoroughly.
Lizzie: So you know about my relationship with your C.E.O. William Darcy?
Tour Leader: Or your lack of one.
Seriously though, don't worry about it.
[cell phone vibrates]
Okay, apparently you're not supposed to abandon a school group in the cafeteria.
I'm still getting used to this whole tour guide thing, but I will be right back
with your access passes and your parking permit.
Lizzie: Oh, I didn't bring my car.
Tour Leader: Smart! Though, the hills in this city are pretty unforgiving.
No car is one less thing to worry about.
Lizzie: And have I mentioned the people here?
How they're all so nice and happy and creatively fulfilled?
The in-house masseuse, the complimentary laundry services,
they have gourmet food and beverages 24 hours a day.
It's like I walked into a mythical place that only exists in stories.
The grad school equivalent of Brigadoon!
But I didn't think the natives of Brigadoon would take too well to having their
C.E.O. called a robot for all of the internet to see.
Unless...they don't like him?
Darcy not liked by his staff...
Tour Leader: Hi again! Sorry about that.
So, uh, here is your access badge,
and in here is a form clearing it with legal
to let you film your videos here.
Lizzie: Um, thank you!
About that, actually, you were saying something before you left to go deal with kids?
Tour Leader: Oh! Yeah, uh, like I said,
I'm not usually a tour guide, I just volunteered for today.
Normally I'm a graphic artist part-time. I actually designed your badge.
Lizzie: Well that, that's not-- oh,
although, actually that's really cool.
Um, uh, about people being fine with my videos?
Tour Leader: Like I said, don't worry about it.
Lizzie: But I'm a worrier. That's my nature so, um, uh,
how many people here watch them?
Tour Leader: Um, most of us.
Okay, at least some of us.
It might actually just be me, but I think they're really great and hilarious.
Lizzie: Hilarious?
Tour Leader: Yeah, well I mean the way you portray William--
sorry, Darcy, uh, that is--
in your videos, it's just a completely different person than the one I,
we here know.
Lizzie: Soâ Darcy's well-liked, then?

[cell phone vibrates]
Tour Leader: Of course.
Man, what are you supposed to do with kids if not let them swim in the rooftop pool?
Sorry, just give me one second.
Lizzie: Oh, okay.
So that's a relief,
that only one person here has seen my videos and she seems nice, and normal, and
doesn't hate me for the things I say about Darcy on them.
And it does make a lot more sense that Darcy's actually liked at Pemberley,
especially considering that everyone smiles when his name is mentioned.
And not even in a creepy Stepford Wives kind of way.
Tour Leader: Sorry! I'm back. I got you a parking pass, just in case.
You never know when you might have a visitor.
Lizzie: Well thank you, you really don't have to go through all this trouble,
especially if you have to wrangle kids.
Tour Leader: No, it's no problem.
I just want to make sure you're comfortable and have everything you need.
Lizzie: Well, I definitely am and do.
Tour Leader: So did I do a decent job as your tour guide?
Lizzie: Yeah, you were great.
Are you looking to do this more often?
Tour Leader: Oh, not really, especially after the class of cannonballers going on upstairs.
Lizzie: Back to graphic designing?
Tour Leader: Yeah. I really like my desk.
And speaking of my desk, I should probably get back to it.
You're really cool, Lizzie Bennet. See you around?
Lizzie: I look forward to it.
Sorry, I don't actually think I caught your name.
Tour Leader: Oh, um, it's...
Georgiana.
But most people call me Gigi.
Lizzie: Gigi.
As in, Gigi Darcy?
Gigi: The one and only.
Hey, let me know if you need anything else.
Lizzie: Okay. Bye...
Gigi.
Otherwise known as Darcy's sister.
Who watches my videos.
Why do I feel like I'm in major trouble right now?
